text: Richard Vincent Allen (January 1, 1936 - November 16, 2024) was the United States National Security Advisor to President Ronald Reagan from 1981 to 1982, having been Reagan's chief foreign policy advisor from 1977. He was a fellow of the Hoover Institution from 1983 until his death. He was a member of the Defense Policy Board Advisory Committee.Peter B. Levy (1996), Encyclopedia of the Reagan-Bush Years, ABC-CLIO, p16socialarchive.iath.virginia.edu, Allen, Richard V. OAC Allen died on November 16, 2024 at a hospital in Denver, Colorado at the age of 88. ==Books== * Allen, Richard V. (1966). Peace and Peaceful Coexistence.
